pages.text: $(item)Upgrades$() allow machines to work better. They do not change what the machines do, just makes them better at it.

The $(item)Overclocker Upgrade$() makes machines work faster, but also makes them use more Zaps.$(br2)You can have up to 4 in a slot, and you can fill as many upgrade slots as you want.$(br2)12 Overclocker Upgrades in a Powered Furnace makes it work near instantly, though at a $(l)much$() greater cost.
The $(item)Energy Storage Upgrade$() allows machines to store more energy. Each adds about 10,000 Zaps.$(br2)You can have up to 4 in a slot, and you can fill as many upgrade slots as you want.
The $(item)Transformer Upgrade$() allows machines to accept higher voltage currents. Each increases the voltage tier by 1.

The $(item)Ejector Upgrade$() will make machines eject their output to an adjacent inventory.$(br2)In order of priority, it tries to push out the right face, then back, left, front, top, then bottom.$(br2)You can have multiple, but like... why would you?
